decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: ALX 3035-C Lux levels-contour plan,  
ALX 3035-D Lux levels-axiomatic plan 'B' Building,
ALX 3035-E Lux levels-axiomatic plan 'A' Building,
ALX 3035-F Light baffle designs,
ALX 3035-G Light baffle dimensions.

Condition : 3 - The floodlighting hereby permitted shall only operate between the hours of 08.00 and 21.30 on any day.

Condition : 4 - The floodlighting hereby approved shall be installed and operated in accordance with the details shown on drawing ALX 3035-C and shall not exceed the lux levels set out in the approved drawings and documents.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and
occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with
policy PE.3 of the Adopted Merton Unitary Development plan 2003.
Condition : 5 - The floodlights and columns hereby permitted shall be finished in 'holly bush' green - BS14C39 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development.
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that the Council requests a survey of luminescence be carried out once the floodlighting is installed and that Council Officers be present to witness the test.
Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: In order to comply with the Wildlife & Countryside Act 1981 the applicant should ensure that all trenches that are left open overnight should include a means of escape for badgers; all large diameter pipes should be closed off during the night and obvious badger pathways should be left clear of obstruction and gaps in or under fences should be left clear to enable animals to reach foraging areas.
Condition : 8 -  REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The design and siting of the floodlighting scheme are considered acceptable and, suitabley conditioned, would not result in any harm to neighbour amenity. The proposal accords with the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan, Core Strategy and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.
The London Plan (June 2011) 4.6 (Support for and enhancement of sports provision), 3.19 (Sports facilities),  7.19 (Biodiversity and access to nature).

Condition : 9 - REASONS FOR APPROVAL (cont'd).
Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) CS.13 Open space, nature conservation, leisure and culture. CS.14 Design
Merton Unitary Development Plan (2003)
L.5: Urban Green Space BE.22 Design of New Development
BE.15 New Buildings and Extensions - Daylight, Sunlight, Privacy, Visual Intrusion and Noise, PE.3 Light Pollution.
